translation: This same multitude of beings, being born again and again, helplessly dissolves, O Arjuna, into the Unmanifested at the coming of the night and comes forth at the coming of the day.
commentary: 8.19 Bhutagram: multitude of beings? He's that? Eve verily? This is this? Being being born again and again? dissolves dissolves? Ratryagame at the coming of night? Of course helpless? Partha O Partha? Prabhavati comes forth? Aharagame at the coming of day.Commentary Avidya (ignorance)? Kama (desire) and Karma (action) are the three knots that bind the individual to Samsara. Desire is born of ignorance. Man exerts
